title: NGT notice to CPCB, Bihar authorities over rise in lightning deaths due to felling of palm trees
content: According to a newspaper report, after the ban on toddy tapping due to Bihar's prohibition policy, palm trees lost their economic value and have since been widely cut down

title: Delay in transmission lines stalls railway electrification progress on Bengaluru-Mysuru-Mangaluru route
content: According to officials, SWR could save up to ₹4.36 crore every month by switching eight pairs of trains on this section from diesel to electric traction.

title: Nilambur result crucial for LDF, UDF ahead of upcoming polls
content: Both fronts claim that the electoral fight is mainly between them. However, they are reportedly apprehensive about the campaigns of the BJP and P.V. Anvar upsetting their duopoly in Nilambur via covert tactical voting in key panchayats

title: Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary calls Lalu Prasad ‘Gabbar’ of Bihar
content: The BJP leader defends Chief Minister Nitish Kumar over the repeated attacks by Opposition leader Tejashwi Yadav and terms Kumar a ‘conscious’ leader

title: Residents beyond 500 metres of Assam blowout gas well advised to return home
content: ONGC clears path for well capping operations, says there is no detectable trace of hydrocarbons beyond 30 metres of the gas leak site

title: Teachers wait for jobs and justice
content: More than 25,000 teachers and non-teaching staff have lost their jobs after the Supreme Court found that the appointments were fraught with ‘irregularities’. Thousands of women and men will now have to retake the examination again, to qualify for a teacher’s job. As the West Bengal government prepares for the fresh recruitment process, Shrabana Chatterjee and Moyurie Som speak to those who are unable to reconcile with the idea of going through the recruitment process again

title: State government to amend rules related to various departments to spur investments
content: Policies and rules related to the Departments of Local Self-Government, Revenue, Electricity, Environment, Labour, Agriculture, Higher Education, and General Policies and Rules will be updated or amended to make them investment-friendly

title: Jahnavi of Palakollu selected as Astronaut Candidate for Titans Space Mission
content: Jahnavi will undergo intensive astronaut training through Titan Space’s ASCAN programme for the mission slated for launch in 2029

title: Air India plane crash: wreckage being shifted to airport premises in Ahmedabad
content: Apart from AAIB, the U.S. National Transportation Safety Board is leading a parallel investigation into the plane crash

title: Sodium vapour lamps to be a thing of the past in Bengaluru as project to replace them with LED bulbs takes off
content: Currently, the electricity bill for street lights in the city is a whopping ₹25 crore per month, despite 44% of the street lights already being equipped with LED bulbs; replacing the rest of the sodium vapour lamps with LED lights is expected to cut the cost by at least 50%

title: Leaked audio clip got much hype rather than the corruption charge I made, says B.R. Patil
content: It is my voice in the audio clip but, I do not know who leaked it. I have only spoken the truth and truth ultimately wins: Aland MLA

title: Left parties condemn U.S. strikes on Iran
content: The Left parties said Israel launched an attack on Iran on June 12 to sabotage any potential negotiations between the latter and the U.S. and now, the U.S. has joined Israel in this act of aggression

title: Man killed in anti-Naxal operation is not Maoist, was a govt. school cook, says family
content: Mahesh Kudiyam had only gone to graze his cattle on the day of the encounter, his brother says. The police acknowledge that he was as a government school cook but maintain that he was a Maoist

title: Dalits have been truly empowered under NDA rule, says BJP
content: It accuses the Congress party of using Dr. Ambedkar’s name for political gain, while ignoring his vision and disrespecting his ideals

title: Cautious welcome to final notification on area around Kappatagudda Wildlife Sanctuary
content: Now, organisations plan to hold in-depth discussion with all those concerned, including Gadag Tontdarya seer

title: With money and manpower, India could achieve quantum satellite communication by 2030, says expert
content: Safe quantum communication requires enabling a sender and receiver to get ‘quantum keys’, which are made of streams of photons — the carriers of light

title: Another flight from Iran carrying 311 Indians lands in Delhi; over 1,400 evacuated so far
content: The Ministry of External Affairs said 311 Indians landed in Delhi on a special flight from the Iranian city of Mashhad.

title: Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple employee held for milk theft
content: This incident comes in the wake of the mysterious disappearance of a gold rod weighing nearly 13 sovereigns last month.

title: Munambu ecotourism centre in Idukki turning into a major tourist draw
content: The scenic view of the Idukki reservoir and trekking through the forest area to the dam catchment area is the major attraction of the Munambu ecotourism project.

title: Serial offender held in land dispute case
content: Arrested near a lodge at Koppal in Karnataka by a special police party, the accused is wanted in 47 criminal cases across nine States

title: Information Commission orders SCOLE Kerala and Nirmithi Kendras to adhere to RTI Act
content: The Commission has instructed the authorities concerned in both cases to immediately appoint RTI officers in these institutions, and to provide the requested information to the petitioners within 15 days.

title: Activist sees corruption in Women and Child Welfare Department
content: He seeks action against two Deputy Directors for misappropriation of funds and diversion of milk powder meant for anganwadis

title: 329 booked in Cyberabad drunk driving crackdown
content: The Cyberabad Police warned that in cases where an inebriated driver causes a fatal crash, they will be booked under Section 105 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, 2023, which pertains to culpable homicide not amounting to murder

title: Nilambur byelection results on Monday
content: Votes will be counted at Mar Thoma Government Higher Secondary School, Chungathara, from 8 a.m. The votes polled in the 263 polling stations will be counted in 19 rounds

title: Tomato transportation hit by shortage of crates in Madanapalle division
content: Farmers hit by extensive financial losses say that they are helpless despite bumper crops as several traders and middlemen are not providing crates over plummeting prices

title: Concern over push for Adani power project in Assam
content: Locals have been protesting against the decision to allot 992 acres of land to the group in the Banshbari-Paglijhora area under the Bodoland Territorial Council

title: Draft regulations on renewable energy: Kerala State Electricity Regulatory Commission to hold online hearings in July
content: Virtual hearings will be held from July 8 to July 11. Commission says online mode will guarantee greater stakeholder participation from across the State

title: Kalikuppam residents seek urgent repair to damaged community hall and anganwadi
content: The two facilities were constructed in 2008 by a New Delhi-based trust as part of post-tsunami relief effort but have since fallen into disuse because of lack of maintenance

title: Sewage lifting station to come up in Khajamalai in Tiruchi
content: It is expected to rectify the design flaws in the sewer network which has pipes that are more than 20 years old and were laid uneven causing frequent blockages and bursts

title: Youth’s ‘detention and assault’ in police custody triggers row at Kadiri in Sri Sathya Sai district
content: The youth’s mother and grandmother accuse sub-inspector of manhandling them for questioning the ‘injustice’, stage dharna along with kin; Superintendent of Police orders inquiry into the incident

title: Air India to temporarily reduce flights operated with narrow-body planes on 19 routes
content: "This voluntary decision leads to the temporary suspension of Air India's services on 3 routes and reduction of frequency on 19 routes. The changes are effective until at least 15 July 2025," it said.

title: Telugu actor Vijay Deverakonda booked under SC/ST Act for derogatory remarks against tribals
content: The complainant stated that the comments were not only offensive but deeply insulting to the dignity and self-respect of the tribal community

title: Permanent library building nearing completion in Kilvelur taluk
content: The new building will have a dedicated study area for students preparing to write the TNPSC and UPSC examinations

title: NBA Finals Game 7 preview: Stars, X factors, picks
content: The Pacers and Thunder face off in a season finale. Here's everything you need to know for the winner-take-all showdown.

title: Foster out as Capers, Tiven, Wright ref Game 7
content: Veteran NBA official Scott Foster was not selected as one of the three referees for Sunday's Game 7, as James Capers, Josh Tiven and Sean Wright were chosen to handle the finale between the Thunder and Pacers.

title: Jones, 37, retires; White: Aspinall now champion
content: Jon Jones, 37, widely considered the greatest mixed martial artist of all time, has retired, UFC CEO Dana White announced Saturday and the heavyweight later confirmed on social media, saying the decision came "after a lot of reflection."

title: Game 7 line drops as Pacers try for Finals upset
content: Multiple sportsbooks reported taking bets on the underdog Pacers from sharp bettors, causing the Game 7 point spread to drop by as many as two points.

title: Three dead, 70 injured in Algeria stadium fall
content: Three spectators died and more than 70 others were injured after falling from the upper stand of a stadium following MC Alger's Algerian top-flight title win.

title: Orioles say Rutschman out through All-Star break
content: Orioles catcher Adley Rutschman will be out through the All-Star break due to the left oblique strain that landed him on the injured list for the first time in his career, interim manager Tony Mansolino told reporters.

title: Anderson's shutout has LSU on brink of MCWS title
content: Kade Anderson pitched a three-hitter as LSU moved within a win of its second national championship in three years with a 1-0 victory over Coastal Carolina.

title: Yarbrough to IL in another hit to Yanks' pitching
content: The Yankees' pitching took another hit as Ryan Yarbrough was put on the 15-day injured list with a strained right oblique.

title: Extreme heat ails Reds' De La Cruz, M's Thornton
content: Reds shortstop Elly De La Cruz and Mariners reliever Trent Thornton fell ill while playing in temperatures that exceeded 90 degrees.

title: 📈 Final NBA draft big board for top 100 prospects
content: Who made big jumps in the top 10? Where do the Duke, Rutgers players rank? Here's our final top 100 big board.

title: Jon Jones' MMA résumé isn't ruined by not fighting Tom Aspinall
content: No, the last chapter of Jon Jones' UFC career doesn't negate his legacy, yet it does add a "but" to the end.

title: What gives MLB's best teams their edge? Every current playoff contender's biggest strength
content: For clubs currently leading the postseason hunt, here's the one thing most driving their success so far.

title: Club World Cup first-week takeaways: Uneven attendance, sweltering heat
content: ESPN's writers share their takeaways from the first week of the tournament. Here's what you need to know from Saturday in the Club World Cup.

title: Three trades to help Boston avoid its impending financial crunch
content: The Celtics face an offseason of uncertainty. Here are their options ahead of the draft, including three big trades.

title: 5 storylines, 12 players and 1 defining NBA offseason coming up
content: Here are the biggest stories this offseason. And how they resolve could dramatically impact next season.

title: Passan: How the Red Sox 'absolutely botched' the Devers divorce
content: As Devers prepares to play against his former team, a look inside the clubhouse culture that helped cause the divorce.

title: Rankings of MLB starters, relievers and their arsenal of pitches over the past three seasons
content: A stat rooted in Game Theory reveals who's maximizing their arsenals, and who's leaving outs on the table.

title: 'He can do anything': Why Liverpool spent big to sign Wirtz
content: Liverpool have broken their transfer record to sign Wirtz from Bayer Leverkusen for an initial £100m.

title: USMNT's Wright (Achilles) out for rest of Gold Cup
content: USMNT forward Haji Wright has been ruled out for the remainder of the Concacaf Gold Cup with an Achilles injury, U.S. Soccer announced on Saturday.

title: Jobe Bellingham: First Dortmund goal 'surreal'
content: Jobe Bellingham said his first goal for Borussia Dortmund was a surreal experience as the new signing made an immediate impact at the Club World Cup.

title: Pep: Some City players will be 'sad' if they stay
content: Pep Guardiola has suggested he will slim down his Manchester City squad before the end of the transfer window to avoid having "sad" players next season.

title: Inter snatch late win to break Urawa Reds' hearts
content: Valentin Carboni scored in the second minute of second-half stoppage time to complete Inter Milan's rally to a 2-1 victory over Urawa Red Diamonds.

title: Cazorla helps Oviedo end 24-year LaLiga absence
content: Real Oviedo sealed their return to LaLiga after 24 years with a 3-2 aggregate victory over Mirandes in Saturday's promotion play-off.

title: Frimpong: Wirtz makes Liverpool move 'extra fun'
content: Jeremie Frimpong has told ESPN the arrival of Florian Wirtz, his former Bayer Leverkusen teammate, at Liverpool has made his move "extra fun."

title: Sources: Onana wants Man Utd stay this summer
content: André Onana is keen to stay at Manchester United despite interest from Monaco, sources have told ESPN.

title: The USMNT is a mess. That's the price of the U.S. becoming a 'soccer country'
content: The more the U.S. cares about soccer and produces better players, the more dysfunctional the USMNT becomes. That's just how it is.

title: 'The Lakers can finally be run like a real business': Leaguewide reaction to the stunning sale
content: The Lakers have spent decades lagging behind other NBA teams in ways known -- and not. This sale presents a massive opportunity for them to catch up -- and expedite their chase for title No. 18.

title: Who are the best players in the 2026 NFL draft class? We picked the top five at every position
content: Matt Miller and Jordan Reid stack their early top-fives at every position and break down the players they'll be watching during the 2025 season.

title: Barnwell picks the NFL's top luxuries: The best players at 11 specialized roles
content: Gadget player, slot cornerback, swing tackle, backup quarterback -- these players are the best at their very specific roles.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea to rival Juventus for Kolo Muani deal
content: Chelsea have entered the race to sign Paris Saint-Germain striker Randal Kolo Muani. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: At Jackie Robinson's high school, a fire-ravaged city rebuilds
content: After 1 in 4 students lost their homes or were displaced by the Eaton fire, their school held them together.

title: "Economic Suicide": Marco Rubio On Possible Strait Of Hormuz Closure By Iran
content: Marco Rubio said a move to close the strait would be a massive escalation that would merit a response from the US and others.

title: Exclusive: Atomic Agency Veteran Warns of Global Nuclear Risk After US Attack On Iran
content: In a significant escalation of geopolitical tensions, the US launched a targeted military strike on Iran's nuclear facilities, raising global concerns about the potential fallout and future implications.

title: 'Will Not Let Maoists Sleep Even During Monsoon': Amit Shah
content: Delivering a firm message in Nava Raipur of Chhattisgarh on Sunday, Union Home Minister Amit Shah reaffirmed the Centre's commitment to ending Maoism in India by March 31, 2026.

title: Top Democrats Not Briefed Before US Strikes On Iranian Nuclear Sites: Report
content: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer and House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries were reportedly notified after the bombs had dropped.

title: Deception, Decoys: Inside Op Midnight Hammer That Targeted Iran Nuke Sites
content: The US military today explained how exactly the operation to bomb three nuclear sites in Iran unfolded. B-2 stealth aircraft dropped bunker-buster bombs on a fortified nuclear facility, while submarine-launched cruise missiles hit two other sites.

title: Arab States Condemn US Strikes On Iran, Warn Of Regional Escalation
content: Arab countries on Sunday strongly condemned the US air strikes on nuclear facilities in Iran, warning of serious repercussions and calling for a return to diplomacy.

title: US Strikes On Iran Nuclear Sites Are Real-Life Test Of Hard Power's Limits
content: US military strikes overnight in which President Donald Trump said Iran's main nuclear sites were "obliterated" will put to the test the widely held view that such attacks can delay a nuclear programme but not kill a determined push for atom bombs.

title: How Iran Is Likely To Respond To US Strikes
content: The United States' strikes on Iranian nuclear sites raised two major questions: how effective were they, and what will Iran do next?

title: Centre Clears Major Road Projects In Nashik Ahead Of Simhastha Kumbh Mela
content: A meeting was held at the Chief Minister's Secretariat in Nagpur's Hyderabad House. The 2027 Sinhastha Kumbha Mela in Nashik was the top agenda. The meeting focused on improving the road infrastructure to handle the surge in pilgrims in the city.

title: Air India To Scale Back Narrow-Body Operations Across 19 Routes Until Mid-July
content: Air India has announced a considerable but temporary five per cent reduction in its narrow-body flight operations across select domestic and short-haul international routes.

title: Burnt Remains Of Sonam Raghuvanshi's 'Black Bag' Recovered From Indore
content: The charred remains of a black bag belonging to Sonam Raghuvanshi have been retrieved from Madhya Pradesh's Indore.

title: Four Men Fire in Air, Attack Dalit Family In Madhya Pradesh
content: A shocking case of caste violence and lawlessness has emerged from Lalpur village under Karera tehsil in Shivpuri district, Madhya Pradesh, where four upper-caste men - recently released from jail - allegedly stormed the house of a Dalit former sarpa

title: Meghalaya Honeymoon Murder: Police Arrest Security Guard, Property Dealer
content: A special investigation team (SIT) of the Meghalaya Police on Sunday arrested two persons in Madhya Pradesh in connection with the murder of Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi, a senior officer said.

title: Did Jagan Reddy's Car Hit Man? Party Claims "Doctored Video"
content: Yet another massive controversy has erupted in Andhra Pradesh in connection with former Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy's visit to the home of a former sarpanch in Palnadu district.

title: Israeli Forces Recover Bodies Of Three Hostages From Gaza
content: Israeli forces have recovered the bodies of three hostages which had been held in the Gaza Strip since the Palestinian group Hamas' 2023 attack, the military and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said.

title: After US Strikes, Iran Plans To Close Oil Corridor Strait Of Hormuz: Report
content: Iran is considering closing the key oil shipping route Strait of Hormuz after the US bombed three of its nuclear facilities, Iranian media reported today.

title: Despite Clashes With US Presidents, Netanyahu Usually Gets His Way
content: A little over a month ago, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu appeared to have been shunted to the shadows by US President Donald Trump, who hopscotched the Middle East without visiting Israel, traditionally Washington's closest regional ally.

title: United Behind Iran War Effort, Israelis Express Relief At US Bombing
content: Israelis expressed relief and optimism after US President Donald Trump ordered air strikes on Iran, 10 days into a war that has widespread public support.

title: 'Yellow' Alert For Rain, Thunderstorm In Delhi Tomorrow: Weather Office
content: A 'yellow' alert has been issued for light to moderate rainfall accompanied with thunderstorm and gusty winds at speeds of 30 to 40 kilometres per hour in Delhi, the weather department said.

title: Tesla To Launch Paid Robotaxi Service In Austin With Driverless Model Y SUVs
content: Elon Musk's vision of Tesla's future is set for a public test, when a dozen or so self-driving cars in Austin, Texas start a limited, paid robotaxi service.

title: Speed up work on ongoing R&B projects: Komatireddy
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the latest news is from the world of cinema and streaming . today's Cache Your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . science writers take the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: IND vs ENG: Pant joins Dhoni in elite list, third Indian to achieve this feat
content: Rishabh Pant achieved a significant milestone, securing his 150th Test catch, joining Indian wicketkeeping legends. He celebrated his comeback with a brilliant 134, marking his seventh Test century, highlighted by a memorable somersault. Pant's explosive batting and charismatic presence continue to solidify his role as a key match-winner for India.

title: How Bill Gates and Melinda Gates reacted when their daughter announced her startup
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, has launched Phia, an e-commerce app co-founded with Sophia Kianni. The platform utilizes AI to compare prices across numerous websites, offering users a comprehensive view of both new and second-hand fashion items. Bill Gates initially expressed concern about potential financial requests and involvement but ultimately supported Phoebe's entrepreneurial endeavor.

title: Another evacuation flight from Iran lands in Delhi with 311 Indians
content: India evacuated 311 more citizens from Mashhad on Sunday. The special flight landed in Delhi. This brought the total evacuees to 1,428 under Operation Sindhu. The operation aims to bring back Indian nationals from Iran and Israel. Evacuation flights operated from Mashhad, Yerevan, and Ashgabat. India is monitoring the regional situation for safe return of citizens.

title: Will possible Hormuz oil corridor impact India? Explained in 10 points
content: Amidst US-Iran tensions and potential Strait of Hormuz closure, India, importing 2 million bpd through it, feels secure. Diversified sources like Russia, the US, and Brazil offer alternatives. Gas supplies remain unaffected. While near-term oil prices may surge to $80/barrel, India's strategic reserves and alternative sourcing strategies provide a buffer against disruptions, ensuring energy security despite global volatility.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Call it the Tendulkar-Anderson Trophy' - Gavaskar questions naming order of Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy
content: Sunil Gavaskar has voiced his disapproval of the India-England Test series being named the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, arguing that Sachin Tendulkar's name should take precedence due to his seniority and superior achievements. Gavaskar criticized the ECB's decision and urged Indian fans and media to refer to the series as the Tendulkar-Anderson Trophy.

title: Elon Musk’s simple life: World’s richest says will never own 5 things
content: Elon Musk, despite his immense wealth, maintains a surprisingly minimalist lifestyle. He sold numerous properties, opting for a small Boxabl home and even crashing at friends' places. Musk once lived on $1 a day and famously crashed a McLaren, never replacing it, showcasing his detachment from luxury possessions and focus on his ventures.

title: 'You may be No.1, but ...': Brook earns praise as Bumrah duel lights up Leeds
content: Harry Brook's impressive 99 against India at Headingley showcased a blend of maturity and audacity. The Yorkshire batter's innings, marked by resilience and flair, helped England approach a 400-run total. Despite falling short of a century, Brook's compelling duel with Bumrah earned respect and highlighted his game awareness, solidifying his status as a key player.

title: ‘Value on things’: Meghan Markle says Archie and Lilibet sell garden veggies
content: Meghan Markle revealed that Prince Archie and Princess Lilibet sell homegrown produce at a local farmers' market. She and Prince Harry want their children to understand the value of things. The children also participate in gardening at home. Meghan finds joy in preparing lunchboxes for Archie and Lilibet using their garden's vegetables. She finds it therapeutic after a long day, she says.

title: GitHub CEO to software engineers: ‘Key for winning’ AI coding tools is in ….
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke emphasizes the importance of developers retaining hands-on coding skills alongside AI tools. He warns against over-reliance on AI-generated code, advocating for a flexible workflow where developers can seamlessly switch between AI assistance and direct coding.

title: 'When this president speaks, world should listen': US briefs on Op 'Midnight Hammer' against Iran
content: The United States defense department announced the success of Operation Midnight Hammer, which aimed to dismantle Iran's nuclear capabilities through targeted strikes on key facilities like Fordow, Isfahan, and Natanz.

title: Karisma Kapoor joins Sunjay Kapur’s wife Priya Sachdev in prayer meet
content: Karisma Kapoor was seen offering prayers alongside Priya Sachdev, the current wife of her late ex-husband Sunjay Kapur, at an emotional prayer meet held in Delhi. The solemn gathering took place on June 22 at the Taj Palace Hotel, following Sunjay’s untimely demise on June 12 during a polo match in England. He was 53.

title: How Top Gun: Maverick eerily predicted Operation Midnight Hammer
content: In June 2025, President Trump—new term, same instincts—ordered a real-world operation that bore eerie resemblance to Maverick. Seven B-2 bombers took off from the US under the cloak of midnight. The mission: Operation Midnight Hammer. The target: Iran’s Fordow uranium enrichment facility, buried in the mountains near Qom. A site designed to withstand everything short of Armageddon. A site built for this very moment.

title: ‘He didn’t speak to me’: Ganguly reveals fallout with Laxman, shares details
content: Sourav Ganguly revealed VVS Laxman's disappointment after being excluded from India's 2003 World Cup squad, leading to a three-month silence between them. Ganguly admitted the decision, favouring Dinesh Mongia, caused a rift, despite Laxman's ODI record. Although controversial, Laxman returned post-World Cup, proving his value in subsequent series, and Ganguly emphasized the decision wasn't personal, as India reached the final.

title: 'Won't be intimidated by noise made by Trump': Iran after US strikes; says diplomacy not an option
content: The United States launched targeted airstrikes on Iranian nuclear facilities, prompting strong condemnation from Iran, who vowed to continue its nuclear program. President Trump hailed the strikes as a success, warning of further action if Iran doesn't comply with US demands. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu applauded the move, calling it a historic turning point and praising US-Israel cooperation.

title: Brittany Mahomes' unexpected night out: Spotted with Travis Kelce, not Patrick
content: Brittany Mahomes enjoyed a concert with Travis Kelce and friends. Patrick Mahomes and Taylor Swift were absent from shared photos. This get-together highlighted the strong bond within the Kansas City Chiefs' circle. It happened after Kelce and Swift's appearance at the Stanley Cup Final. The event showcased the camaraderie beyond football. The Chiefs aim for another championship run.

title: Adin Ross returns with Brand Risk 008: Date, full fight card revealed
content: Adin Ross is set to host Brand Risk 008 in Nashville on June 22, 2025, featuring a main event between Charleston White and Kodiyakredd. The event, streamed live on Kick, includes nine influencer matchups with personalities like Scam Likely, Julian Newman, and Supreme Patty. Following a chaotic Brand Risk 007, expect more drama and unexpected moments.

title: Iran eyes retaliation after US airstrikes: Key US bases now in crosshairs
content: In a significant escalation, the US has launched airstrikes targeting Iranian nuclear sites, including Fordo, Isfahan, and Natanz, using powerful bunker-buster bombs. Iran has warned of a decisive response, raising concerns about regional security. Key US military installations like Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar and the US Navy's Fifth Fleet in Bahrain are potential targets for Iranian retaliation.

title: 'Won't let them sleep': Amit Shah's monsoon mandate for operation against Naxalism
content: Union home minister Amit Shah has issued a stern warning to Naxalites, declaring that anti-Naxal operations will persist through the monsoon season. Shah urged Naxalites to abandon armed struggle and integrate into mainstream society, promising support and fulfillment of commitments from the Chhattisgarh government and the Centre.

title: IND v ENG: 'Actually thought of 3 celebrations': Pant reveals as somersault goes viral
content: Rishabh Pant marked his Test century at Headingley with a memorable somersault, revealing he had other celebrations in mind. His explosive century off 146 balls, including 4 sixes, powered India past 400, aided by a 209-run partnership with Shubman Gill. Pant's return from injury has been remarkable, highlighted by this viral celebration.

title: Air India flight gets bomb threat: Birmingham to Delhi plane diverted to Riyadh
content: An Air India flight AI114, en route from Birmingham to Delhi on June 21, was diverted to Riyadh after receiving a bomb threat. The aircraft landed safely in Riyadh, where security checks were completed according to an airlines spokesperson. The incident prompted immediate action to ensure the safety of all passengers and crew onboard.

title: 6 ‘Bunker Buster’, 30 Tomahawk missiles: How US 'destroyed' Iran’s key nuclear sites - details
content: In a sudden turn of events, President Trump authorized precision airstrikes on Iran's key nuclear facilities, marking a significant escalation. The US military targeted Fordow, Natanz, and Isfahan using stealth bombers and bunker-buster bombs.

title: Vijay Devarakonda booked for tribals remark; case filed under SC/ST Act
content: Vijay Devarakonda faces legal trouble after allegedly making offensive comments against the tribal community following the Pahalgam terror attack. A case has been registered under the SC/ST Act based on a complaint filed by a tribal community leader.

title: IND vs ENG: Why players are wearing black armbands - who was David Lawrence?
content: India and England cricketers honored David 'Syd' Lawrence, the former England fast bowler, with black armbands. A moment of applause was observed before the start of play at Headingley. Lawrence, who passed away at 61, was remembered for his contributions to cricket. He was the first British-born Black player to represent England.

title: ‘Attacked with chilli powder’: Man beaten to death by ex-lover and husband in Telangana
content: In a gruesome incident in Nalgonda, Telangana, N Janaiah was brutally murdered by his former lover and her husband. The couple, enraged by Janaiah's continued attempts to contact the woman despite prior warnings and a police complaint, attacked him with chilli powder and sticks.

title: IND vs ENG: Fuming coach! Gautam Gambhir visibly angry as Yashasvi Jaiswal spills Jasprit Bumrah’s wicket chance
content: Jasprit Bumrah's brilliance was almost game-changing, but a crucial dropped catch off Harry Brook proved costly, triggering visible frustration from captain Shubman Gill and coach Gautam Gambhir. Despite multiple dropped catches, Bumrah's class remains unquestioned, with Ravi Shastri hailing him as India's best-ever fast bowler.

title: IND vs ENG: Rishabh Pant's six makes Headingley security official an instant hero – WATCH
content: India amassed 471 runs in their first innings against England. Shubman Gill, Rishabh Pant, and Yashasvi Jaiswal each scored centuries. Jaiswal and KL Rahul earlier built a strong opening partnership. Gill and Pant then dominated with a 209-run stand. Pant's aggressive innings included six sixes. This was Pant’s seventh Test century, surpassing MS Dhoni’s record.

title: Virat who? Ex-cricketer forgets Virat Kohli's name after Shubman Gill's animated celebration - WATCH
content: Shubman Gill's exuberant celebration after a near dismissal of Joe Root sparked commentary box comparisons to Virat Kohli. Despite the overturned decision, Gill marked his Test captaincy debut with a century, joining an elite list of Indian players. He also reached 2,000 Test runs, mirroring Kohli's achievement in his captaincy debut.

title: 'Gravely concerned': Pak slams US strikes on Iran; day after nominating Trump for Nobel
content: Pakistan strongly condemned US airstrikes on Iran's nuclear facilities, expressing deep concern over escalating tensions in the Middle East. This statement follows Pakistan's recent endorsement of President Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize for his role in de-escalating tensions between India and Pakistan. Islamabad urged dialogue and diplomacy to resolve the crisis, emphasizing the need to protect civilian lives.

title: Sunjay Kapur's prayer meet: Karisma & Kareena Kapoor head to Delhi
content: Karisma Kapoor, accompanied by her children Samaira and Kiaan, journeyed to Delhi for the prayer meet of her former husband, Sunjay Kapur, who tragically passed away from a heart attack in London. Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan were also seen at the airport, joining the family to pay their respects at the Taj Palace Hotel.

title: ‘Highest in 2 yrs': India ups oil imports from Russia, US; strategy over panic amid Iran-Israel war
content: Amidst Iran-Israel tensions, India has significantly increased its Russian oil imports, surpassing combined purchases from Saudi Arabia and Iraq. This shift, driven by discounted prices, sees Russian oil constituting a substantial portion of India's crude imports.

title: Next West Bengal CM or Team India head coach? Ganguly drops a hint
content: Sourav Ganguly has firmly dismissed any interest in entering politics, but remains open to coaching the Indian cricket team in the future. While praising current coach Gautam Gambhir's passion and straightforward approach, Ganguly emphasized the importance of giving Gambhir time to grow in the role.

title: Watch: Smoke rises over Tel Aviv as Iran fires missiles post US strike; several injured
content: Following US strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities, Tehran launched a missile barrage on Israel, injuring 86. Buildings and vehicles sustained damage, with witnesses reporting a massive explosion. The attack followed Trump's warning of severe consequences for further aggression, while Iranian leaders condemned US involvement, threatening irreparable damage.

title: Chandigarh-Lucknow IndiGo flight cancelled: Pilot reports technical issue
content: An IndiGo flight from Chandigarh to Lucknow was cancelled on Friday due to a technical issue detected before taxiing, ensuring passenger safety through disembarkation. Passengers were accommodated on alternate flights or offered refunds. This incident occurred amidst other aviation disruptions, including an Air India Express flight diversion and an IndiGo flight's emergency landing due to low fuel.

title: Honeymoon murder: Property dealer arrested - how he helped Sonam destroy evidence
content: Indore property dealer, Silom James, has been arrested by Shillong police in connection with the Raja Raghuwanshi murder case. James is accused of stealing items, including a pistol and cash, from a flat used by the victim and an associate. CCTV footage shows James removing a bag from the flat and installing security cameras shortly after the murder.

title: IND vs ENGL 'I played with Kapil Dev but ... ': Ravi Shastri calls Jasprit Bumrah 'greatest' of all time
content: Ravi Shastri has declared Jasprit Bumrah as India's best-ever fast bowler, even surpassing Kapil Dev, highlighting his ability to dismantle any opposition across formats. Shastri compared Bumrah's skill in reading batsmen to that of Malcolm Marshall, noting his improved swing with the new ball.

title: MP shocker: Woman, child kidnapped at gunpoint; police suspect love angle
content: In Chhatarpur district's Sumeri village, a shocking incident occurred. A woman and her child were allegedly abducted. Sanjay Singh Lodhi and his group are the accused. They reportedly fired shots and assaulted the woman's husband, Hariram Prajapati. Police are investigating the case. They are examining a video of the abduction.

title: The ultimate Game 7 betting guide: Best bets, insights, advice and more
content: Indiana dominated Game 6 in surprising fashion, leading by 30 points after three quarters en route to a 108-91 victory . a loss in Game 7 would tarnish the legitimacy of OKC's breakout season . the Oklahoma City Thunder have been nearly unbeatable this postseason .

title: 'Best pitcher on the planet': Anderson's historic outing has LSU one win from title
content: Kade Anderson strikes out 10 in game 1 of men's college world series finals . the 20-year-old threw only the second complete game of his collegiate career . he also shutout just the third complete game shutout seen in the current 22-year era .

title: Ranking the Premier League's £100m transfers after Wirtz
content: the 22-year-old midfielder will become only the fifth player to move to (or within) the premier league for over £100m . arne slot convinced Florian Wirtz to chose Liverpool over other rivals . we rank the previous four based on how successful they've been .

title: What's wrong with the Aces? Breaking down Las Vegas' slow start
content: the Las Vegas Aces are 5-6, having lost four of their past five . they are tied for seventh place in the WNBA in scoring average, offensive and defensive rating and net rating . three-time MVP A'ja Wilson has missed the past three games in concussion protocol .

title: Madrid hopeful Mbappé returns in last group game
content: Xabi Alonso says Kylian Mbappé is "better" as he recovers from gastroenteritis . the french international has not travelled with the team to Charlotte, North Carolina . he was hospitalized this week after being hospitalized .

title: From crowd-surfing with the Stanley Cup to Dairy Queen: Inside Brad Marchand's post-title tour
content: it's been 14 years since Brad Marchand last had the chance to party with the Stanley Cup . he's older and wiser -- in the sense that he won't be getting a misspelled tattoo . but the man still knows how to celebrate a championship .

title: Draft trades: Five deals that would shake up the first round

title: Middle East crisis: US bombs Iran; goes into another distant war
content: President Trump sending US troops to bomb Iran without the consent of Congress is a blatant violation of our Constitution. The President’s disastrous decision to bomb Iran without authorization is a grave violation of the Constitution and Congressional War Powers. He has impulsively risked launching a war that may ensnare us for generations. It is absolutely and clearly grounds for impeachment.
